newsitem.title: PHILIPPINES: Philippine annual corn imports seen at 1.0 mln T.
newsitem.headline: Philippine annual corn imports seen at 1.0 mln T.

text.p: The Philippines is expected to increase corn imports from this year's 400,000 tonnes to one million tonnes annually up to the year 2000, experts said on Monday.

The projected increase can be attributed to the low use of high-quality corn seeds by domestic farmers, University of the Philippines Integrated Plant Breeding (IPB) deputy director Manuel Logrono told reporters.
Logrono said low corn production is a result of low utilisation of hybrid corn.
The use of certified corn seeds in the Philippines, Logrono said, is between 17 to 20 percent against 80 to 90 percent in Thailand.
The Department of Agriculture says the Philippines imported an average of 400,000 tonnes of corn yearly between 1990 and 1995 due to inadequate domestic production.
